page.title: 16THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND
page.content:
The Rector used to be responsible for four separate parishes of which only one, CASTLE CARROCK, lies in the study area.
For the last decade these have been merged into a United Benefice with the incumbent serving a scattered community of approx. 15OO. The Rector lives in the Rectory in Castle Carrock. Communion is celebrated by the Rector twice a month, while Matins is sung on the alternate Sunday, led by a local Licensed Reader.
The village of TALKIN also has its own Church and forms part of the Parish of Hayton and Talkin.
The several Chapels have now all disappeared, often being converted to private houses.
